conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Good morning. How have you been feeling since our last visit?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Hello, doctor. I've been feeling better. The pain while urinating has decreased significantly, and I don't have to go as often. The fever and abdominal pain are also gone.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: That's good to hear. Have you been taking the prescribed Nitrofurantoin twice daily as advised?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Yes, I've been taking the medication exactly as you instructed.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Excellent. Have you noticed any side effects from the medication?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: No, doctor. I haven't noticed any side effects.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Good. Let's proceed with a physical examination.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Your vitals are stable, and your lower abdomen is no longer tender. Your lab results also came back, and it confirms that you had a urinary tract infection. However, it seems the antibiotics are working well as your symptoms have improved.

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: That's a relief. So, is the infection all gone now?

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: It seems to be improving, but it's important that you finish the full course of antibiotics. This will ensure that the infection is completely cleared.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Continue drinking plenty of water and avoiding bladder irritants like coffee, alcohol, and spicy foods.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: We'll schedule another follow-up appointment in two weeks to make sure everything is back to normal. If your symptoms return or if you develop new symptoms, please come in immediately.

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Thank you, doctor. I'll continue with the medication and will follow your advice.
